abstract: BHP, the world’s largest mining company, said on Thursday it has received antitrust clearance from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission to proceed with its $39 billion hostile bid for the world’s largest fertilizer maker.
snippet: BHP, the world’s largest mining company, said on Thursday it has received antitrust clearance from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission to proceed with its $39 billion hostile bid for the world’s largest fertilizer maker.
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton has cleared the first regulatory hurdle in its bid for Canada’s Potash Corporation., but any potential deal still faces major regulatory obstacles, especially within Canada.

headline.main: BHP Bid for Potash Clears Antitrust Hurdle
